qas.question: Of what form are Sophie Germain primes?
Of what form are Mersenne primes?

answers.text: 2p − 1, where p is an arbitrary prime

qas.question: What test is especially useful for numbers of the form 2p - 1?
What is the name of one type of prime where p+1 or p-1 takes a certain shape?
What is the name of another type of prime here p+1 or p-1 takes a certain shape?
Of what form are Sophie Germain tests?
Of what form are Mersenne tests?
What test is especially useful for tests of the form 2p-1?
What is the name of one type of test where p+1 or p-1 takes a certain shape?
What is the name of another type of test where p+1 or p-1 takes a certain shape?

context: are prime. Prime numbers of this form are known as factorial primes. Other primes where either p + 1 or p − 1 is of a particular shape include the Sophie Germain primes (primes of the form 2p + 1 with p prime), primorial primes, Fermat primes and Mersenne primes, that is, prime numbers that are of the form 2p − 1, where p is an arbitrary prime. The Lucas–Lehmer test is particularly fast for numbers of this form. This is why the largest known prime has almost always been a Mersenne prime since the dawn of electronic computers.
